# Task

You are given a DataFrame `df_cars` with car data with columns `manufacturer` and `model`. Write a function audi_filter that filters down the dataset to only the rows with manufacturer “audi” and model being “a4 or “a4 quattro”, then it should create a new column `audi_a4_type` that equals `true` across all rows. Then return the resulting DataFrame.



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Here is an example of how you can solve this task:

```julia
using DataFrames, CategoricalArrays

function audi_filter(df::DataFrame)
    df = filter(row -> row.manufacturer == "audi" && (row.model == "a4" || row.model == "a4 quattro"), df)
    df[:audi_a4_type] = true
    return df
end
```

This function first filters the DataFrame to only include rows where the manufacturer is "audi" and the model is either "a4" or "a4 quattro". Then it adds a new column `audi_a4_type` that is set to `true` for all of these filtered rows. Finally, it returns the updated DataFrame.

You can use this function like so:
```julia
df = DataFrame(manufacturer=[ "audi", "bmw", "audi", "mercedes"], model=["a4", "x5", "a4 quattro", "c200"])
new_df = audi_filter(df)
display(new_df)
```
This will print:
| manufacturer | model   | audi_a4_type |
|--------------|---------|---------------|
| "audi"       | "a4"     | true          |
| "audi"       | "a4 quattro"  | true    |
